/* The Beit Trust and other donations */
revision.text:
{{EngvarB|date=August 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=August 2014}} {{Infobox person | name = Alfred Beit<!-- include middle initial, if not specified in birth_name --> | image = Alfred Beit00.jpg<!-- just the filename, without the File: or Image: prefix or enclosing [[brackets]] --> | alt = | caption = Alfred Beit, by [[Giovanni Boldini]] | birth_name = | birth_date = {{Birth date|df=yes|1853|2|15}} | birth_place = [[Hamburg]], [[German Confederation]] | death_date = {{Death date and age|df=yes|1906|7|16|1853|2|15}} | death_place = [[Tewin]], Hertfordshire | nationality = British | networth = £8,050,000<ref name="jewishtopwealth">{{cite journal |last1=Rubinstein |first1=William |title=Jewish top wealth-holders in Britain, 1809–1909 |journal=Jewish Historical Studies |date=2001 |volume=37 |page=135 |url=https://www.jstor.org/stable/29780032 |accessdate=April 24, 2016 |via=[[JSTOR]] |registration=yes }}</ref> | other_names = | occupation = | known_for = }}
'''Alfred Beit''' (15 February 1853 – 16 July 1906) was a British gold and diamond magnate in South Africa, and a major donor and profiteer of infrastructure development on the African continent. He also donated much money to university education and research in several countries, and was the "silent partner" who structured the capital flight from post-Boer War South Africa to [[Rhodesia (region)|Rhodesia]], and the [[Rhodes Scholarship]], named after his employee, [[Cecil Rhodes]].
== Life and career == [[Image:Laura Beit00.jpg|thumb|left|Mrs Laura Beit (Alfred and Otto Beit's mother), by [[Leopold Graf von Kalckreuth|Leopold von Kalckreuth]]]] Born and brought up in [[Hamburg]], [[German Confederation|Germany]], he was the eldest son and second of six children of an affluent Jewish-German citizen of Hamburg. His younger siblings included [[Otto Beit]]. Alfred Beit was an unpromising scholar and was apprenticed to [[Jules Porgès]] & Cie, the Amsterdam diamond firm where he developed a talent for examining stones.<ref name="ReferenceA">{{cite book |first=Martin |last=Meredith |title=Diamonds, Gold, and War: The British, the Boers, and the Making of South Africa |location=New York |publisher=PublicAffairs |year=2007 |isbn=9781586484736 }}</ref>
Beit made his first fortune in property speculation. Responding to a demand for business premises, he bought a piece of land and built twelve corrugated iron sheds for offices and rented eleven out monthly and kept one for himself. Twelve years later he sold the land for a considerable profit.<ref name="ReferenceA" />
Beit was sent to [[Kimberley, South Africa]] in 1875 by his firm to buy diamonds—following the diamond strike at Kimberley. He became a business friend of [[Cecil Rhodes]] through his role in the Kimberley Central Company. Beit was captivated by Rhodes' talk of 'big schemes'.<ref name="ReferenceA" /> Together, they proceeded to buy out digging ventures and to eliminate opposition such as [[Barney Barnato]]. He rapidly became one of a group of financiers who gained control of the diamond-mining claims in the Central, Dutoitspan, and [[De Beers]] mines. Rhodes was the active politician and Beit provided a lot of the planning and financial backing.
Beit's diamond interests were mainly concentrated on Kimberley mine. He focused his main attention on the Kimberley Central Company aiming to expand its interests. He had a major role in the rise of Kimberley Central Company.<ref name="ReferenceA" />
In 1886 Beit extended his interests to the newly discovered goldfields of the [[Witwatersrand]] and met with great success. In his business ventures there he made use of financiers [[Hermann Eckstein]] and [[Joseph Benjamin Robinson|Sir Joseph Robinson]]. He founded the Robertson Syndicate and the firm of Wernher, Beit & Co. He imported mining engineers from the USA and was among the first to adopt deep-level mining. Rhodes purportedly was granted concessions by [[Lobengula]], as a result of which Beit founded the [[British South Africa Company]] in 1888.
Beit became life-governor of De Beers and also a director of numerous other companies such as Rand Mines, Rhodesia Railways and the Beira Railway Company.
In 1888 Beit moved to London when he felt he was better able to manage his financial empire and support Rhodes in his Southern African ambitions. Beit moved into Tewin Water, [[Tewin]], near [[Welwyn]], a large Regency house with Victorian additions and 7,000 acres (28 km²), and a few miles away [[Julius Wernher]] bought [[Luton Hoo]], with 5,218 acres (21.1 km²). In the 1890s, he had a mansion built in [[Park Lane]] – [[Aldford House]].
Inspired by Rhodes' imperialist vision,{{citation needed|date=September 2008}} he took part in the planning and financing of the unsuccessful [[Jameson Raid]] of late 1895 which was intended to trigger a coup in the [[South African Republic]] in the Transvaal. As a result of this debacle, Rhodes resigned as Prime Minister, and both he and Beit were found guilty by the House of Commons inquiry. Beit was obliged to resign as director of the Charter Company, but was elected vice-president of the British South Africa Company a few years later. With the death of Rhodes in 1902, Beit, as one of the trustees, helped control the enormous estate, currently being helped by the [[Oppenheimer]] family of [[De Beers]] and [[Anglo American plc|Anglo-American]].
Beit never married and had no children. He died at Tewin Water on 16 July 1906 after seeing a rapid deterioration in his health. He left an estate of £8,049,886 (equivalent to £{{Inflation|UK-GDP|0.008049886|1906|r=2}} billion in {{Inflation-year|UK-GDP}}{{inflation-fn|UK-GDP}}).<ref name="jewishtopwealth" />
== The Beit Trust and other donations == [[Image:ImperialCollegeLondon.jpg|thumb|Imperial College, London]] During his lifetime, Beit made generous donations for scientific work and education. In 1905 he founded a chair of colonial history at the [[University of Oxford]], which is now the ''[[Beit Professor of Commonwealth History|Beit Professor of History of the British Commonwealth]]''.<ref>University of Oxford, Faculty of History. URL http://www.history.ox.ac.uk/staff/postholder/brown_jm.htm</ref> In 1906 he made the donation of two million mark to the stock capital of the ''Hamburgische Wissenschaftliche Stiftung'', a charity dedicated to spend its interest for the benefit of a precursor of the [[University of Hamburg]].
In his will he set up the [[Beit Trust]] through which he bequeathed large sums of money (£1,200,000) for infrastructure development in the former Northern and Southern Rhodesia, later modified to university education and research in [[Zimbabwe]], [[Zambia]] and [[Malawi]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.beittrust.org.uk|title=HOME|website=www.beittrust.org.uk|access-date=2018-10-19}}</ref>
Significant infrastructure projects financed by the Trust include the [[Birchenough Bridge]] in the former Southern Rhodesia, named after Sir [[Henry Birchenough]], chairman of the Beit Trust from 1931 until 1937 and whose ashes are buried beneath the structure of the bridge.<ref name="heritage">{{Cite web|url=http://rhodesianheritage.blogspot.com/2010/02/birchenough-bridge.html|title=Our Rhodesian Heritage: Birchenough Bridge|language=en|access-date=2018-10-19}}</ref> [[Ralph Freeman (1880–1950)|Ralph Freeman]], the bridge's designer, was also the structural designer on the [[Sydney Harbour Bridge]] and consequently the two bridges bear a close resemblance, although Birchenough is only two-thirds as long as the Australian bridge. It was built by Dorman Long and completed in 1935.<ref name=heritage/> At a length of 1,080 feet (329 m) it was the third longest single-arch suspension bridge in the world at the time.
In recognition of his bequests the [[Royal School of Mines]], a faculty of [[Imperial College London]], erected a large memorial to Beit flanking the entrance to its building. The Imperial College residential halls on [[Prince Consort Road]] was named [[Beit Hall]] after him.
== See also == * Sir [[Otto Beit]], 1st Bt (1865–1930), his brother * Sir [[Alfred Lane Beit]], 2nd Bt (1903–1994), his nephew
== References == {{reflist}}
== Further reading == *{{cite book |last=Albrecht |first=Henning |year=2012 |title=Alfred Beit: The Hamburg Diamond King |location=Hamburg |publisher=Hamburg University Press |isbn=978-3-943423-01-3 }} : [http://blogs.sub.uni-hamburg.de/hup/products-page/publikationen/108/ online]
{{Authority control}}

page.title: American Advertising Federation Hall of Fame

revision.text:
The '''Advertising Hall of Fame''', operated by the [[American Advertising Federation|American Advertising Federation (AAF)]], began in 1948 as a result of a proposal by the New York Ad Club and its president, Andrew Haire, to the Advertising Federation of America, the predecessor organization to the American Advertising Federation. The plan provided that the Advertising Hall of Fame be administered by the Advertising Federation of America on behalf of the entire advertising industry. It honors those men and women who have best served the cause of advertising. Since then, 191 extraordinary individuals have been elected to this illustrious group.
The council of judges and its executive committee are appointed each year by the president of the American Advertising Federation and chair of the Advertising Hall of Fame. These distinguished industry executives are chosen from the ranks of advertisers, agencies, media organizations and academic institutions in the United States. The council of judges considers the election of either living or deceased persons whose record of advertising and service must be accomplished in the United States or with an American company abroad. To be eligible, individuals must be retired from their primary careers.<ref>http://advertisinghall.org/history/index.html</ref>

revision.text:
{{Infobox person |name = Armen Margarian |image = Armen-Margarian.jpg |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1978|9|8}} |birth_place = [[Yerevan|Yerevan, Armenia]] |nationality = Dual – American, Armenian |residence = [[Los Angeles|Los Angeles, California]] |alma mater = [[University of Southern California]]
[[USC Marshall School of Business]] |occupation = CEO, Strategist }} '''Armen Margarian''', JD, MBA ([[Armenian language|Armenian]] Արմեն Մարգարյան) is an American entrepreneur, strategist and the co-founder/CEO of [[NexusLab|NexusLab Inc.]] which was recognized as one of fastest growing private companies in the US in 2009 by the [[Inc. (magazine)|Inc.5000 Magazine]].{{cite web | url = http://www.inc.com/profile/nexuslab | title = NexusLab profile on Inc.5000 | publisher = Inc5000 Magazine | accessdate = March 2010 }} ==Early life and education== Armen Margarian was born in [[Yerevan|Yerevan, Armenia]]. His family moved to the USA when he was a teenager. Margarian graduated from the [[University of Southern California]] with a BS degree in [[Molecular Biology]] in 2001. In 1998, Margarian became a [[Ronald E. McNair Post-Baccalaureate Achievement Program|McNair Scholar]] and conducted extensive research in the field of [[Neurobiology]] at the [[USC School of Pharmacy]]. His research was presented at the 5th International McNair Conference.{{cite web | url = http://mcnair.usc.edu/scholars/1998-1999/armen_margarian.html | title = 1998-1999 USC McNair Scholars | publisher = University of Southern California }} From 2000 to 2002, Margarian conducted research at the UCLA department of Cardiology and Cardiothoracic surgery. He co-authored a research article in the peer-reviewed journal Transplantation on “Cause of Atrioventricular Block in Patients After Heart Transplantation.”.{{cite web | url = http://www.pubfacts.com/detail/12865799/Cause-of-atrioventricular-block-in-patients-after-heart-transplantation | title = Cause of atrioventricular block in patients after heart transplantation. | publisher = Transplantation journal }} Margarian continued his education at the [[USC Marshall School of Business]] and received his MBA in 2006. During his years in graduate school he was the president of the Armenian Graduate Student Association and lead numerous fundraising projects to rebuild schools and hospital around the world.{{cite web | url = http://asbarez.com/53214/usc-agsa-dinner-dance-and-live-auction-raises-25-000/ | title = USC AGSA Dinner Dance and Live Auction Raises $25 000. | publisher = Asbarez }} Margarian frequently lectures at the [[University of Southern California]], [[American University of Armenia]] and The [[Tumo Center for Creative Technologies]].{{cite web | url = http://badarock.com/USC%20Symposium%20on%20Globalization.htm | title = Globalization and the Armenian Church. | publisher = USC }}{{cite web | url = http://www.mediamax.am/am/news/business/7661 | title = Startup Meetup at the Tumo Center | publisher = MediaMax }} ==Career== In May 2002, Margarian and his brother, Hovanes Margarian, co-founded AutoIntel – an automotive enterprise for individual vehicle brokerage and corporate fleet management. From 2006, Margarian started and lead numerous ventures in the United States and Eastern Europe under the NexusLab brand. Some of these ventures were: Eventish.com, LawyerOnIt, ArmeniaOne and LeaseSmart Calculator. The company developed technology that helped organizations and individuals to benefit from various comprehensive solutions. Margarian is the Publisher of the Consumer Law Magazine, Startup Law Magazine and Wise Car Shopper magazine. Currently, Margarian is a manager at The Margarian Law Firm.{{cite web | url = http://www.MargarianLaw.com |title = Margarian Law Website }} ==Public services and philanthropy== Margarian is active in community based and international non-profit organizations. He was a board member of the Armenian American Chamber of Commerce, International Bone Marrow Donor Registry,{{cite web | url = http://www.abmdr.am/Backup-Old-Site/board.html | title = AMBDR Past Board Members | publisher = ABMDR }} President of the USC Armenian Graduate Students Association. He is currently the president, co-founder, of the USC Armenian Alumni Association.{{cite web | url = http://www.uscaaa.org | title = USC AAA Website | publisher = USC Armenian Alumni Association }} Since 2013 Hovanes Margarian and Armen Margarian announced the Margarian Scholarship program.http://asbarez.com/112107/margarian-scholarship-winners-announced/ The scholarship distributes $5,000 to $10,000 annually to exceptional students around the world based on their academic performance and commitment to their heritage, community, and the society at large. ,https://www.cappex.com/scholarship/listings/Margarian-Scholarship/-s-d-48663http://www.internationalscholarships.com/2296/Margarian-Scholarship ==Awards and honors== 1998 USC McNair Scholar.{{cite web | url = http://mcnair.usc.edu/scholars/1998-1999/armen_margarian.html | title = 1998-1999 USC McNair Scholars | publisher = University of Southern California }} ==External links== *[http://www.NexusLab.com NexusLab.com] website *[http://www.MargarianLaw.com MargarianLaw.com] website *[http://www.ArmeniaOne.com ArmeniaOne.com] website ==References== {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Margarian, Armen}} [[Category:Marshall School of Business alumni]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1978 births]] [[Category:People from Yerevan]] [[Category:21st-century American businesspeople]] [[Category:American business writers]] [[Category:American people of Armenian descent]] [[Category:American technology chief executives]] [[Category:American technology company founders]] [[Category:Businesspeople from California]] [[Category:Businesspeople from Los Angeles]] [[Category:Armenian businesspeople]]

{{use mdy dates|date=January 2017}} '''Baumol's cost disease''' (or the '''Baumol effect''') is the rise of salaries in jobs that have experienced no or low increase of labor productivity, in response to rising salaries in other jobs that have experienced higher (low or no) labor productivity growth. This pattern seemingly goes against the theory in [[classical economics]] in which real wage growth is closely tied to [[labor productivity]] changes. The phenomenon was described by [[William J. Baumol]] and [[William G. Bowen]] in the 1960s.<ref name="performing">{{cite book|title=Performing Arts, The Economic Dilemma: a study of problems common to theater, opera, music, and dance|last=Baumol|first=William J.|author2=Bowen|first2=William G.|publisher=M.I.T. Press|year=1966|isbn=0262520117|location=Cambridge, Mass.|pages=}}</ref>
The rise of wages in jobs without productivity gains is from the requirement to compete for employees with jobs that have experienced gains and so can naturally pay higher salaries, just as classical economics predicts. For instance, if the retail sector pays its managers 19th-century-style salaries, the managers may decide to quit to get a job at an automobile factory, where salaries are higher because of high labor productivity. Thus, managers' salaries are increased not by labor productivity increases in the retail sector but by productivity and corresponding wage increases in other industries.
The original study was conducted for the [[performing arts]] sector.<ref name="performing" /> Baumol and Bowen pointed out that the same number of musicians is needed to play a [[Beethoven]] [[string quartet]] today as was needed in the 19th century; the productivity of [[European classical music|classical music]] performance has not increased. On the other hand, the real wages of musicians (as in all other professions) have increased greatly since the 19th century.
In a range of businesses, such as the car manufacturing sector and other activities that involve routine tasks, workers are continually becoming more productive by technological innovations to their tools and equipment. In contrast, in some labor-intensive sectors that rely heavily on non-routine human interaction or activities, such as [[nursing]], [[education]], or the performing arts, there is little or no growth in productivity over time. As with the string quartet example, it takes nurses the same amount of time to change a bandage or college professors the same amount of time to mark an [[essay]] in 2006 as it did in 1966, as those types of activities rely on the movements of the human body, which cannot be engineered to perform more quickly, accurately, or efficiently in the same way that a machine, such as a computer, can.
Baumol's cost disease is often used to describe consequences of the lack of growth in productivity in the [[quaternary sector of the economy]] and [[public service]]s, such as public hospitals and state colleges. Since many [[public administration]] activities are heavily labor-intensive, there is little growth in productivity over time because productivity gains come essentially from a better capital technology.
==Effects, symptoms, and therapy==
Employers may react to cost increases in any number of ways including:{{citation needed|date=May 2015}}
* Decrease quantity/supply * Decrease quality * Decrease profit margins, dividends, or investment * Increase price * Increase non-monetary compensation or employ volunteers * Increase [[total factor productivity]]
In the case of education, the Baumol effect has been used as at least partial justification for the fact that in recent decades, the price of college tuition has risen faster than the general rate of inflation.<ref name=surowiecki>{{cite web | last = Surowiecki | first = James | year = 2011 | url = http://www.newyorker.com/talk/financial/2011/11/21/111121ta_talk_surowiecki | title = Debt by Degrees | publisher = The New Yorker }}</ref>
The reported productivity gains of the service industry in the late 1990s can be attributed most by total factor productivity.<ref name=Bosworth>{{cite web | last = Bosworth | first = Barry P |author2=Jack E Triplett | year = 2003 | url = http://www.brookings.edu/research/articles/2003/09/01business-bosworth | title = Productivity Measurement Issues in Services Industries: "Baumol's Disease" Has been Cured | publisher = The Brookings Institution }}</ref> Providers decreased the cost of ancillary labor through outsourcing or technology. Examples include offshoring data entry and bookkeeping for health care providers and replacing manually-marked essays in educational assessment with [[multiple choice]] tests that can be automatically marked (see [[Scantron]]).
The total factor productivity treatment is not available to the performing arts sector, as the consumable good is the labor itself. Instead, it has been observed that increases in price of the performing arts has been offset by increases in standard of living and entertainment spending by consumers.<ref name=Heilbrun>{{cite web |last=Heilbrun |first=James |year=2003 |url=http://publishing.eur.nl/ir/repub/asset/782/TOWSE%20EBOOK_pages0103-0113.pdf |title=Baumol's Cost Disease |format=PDF |work=A handbook of cultural economics |publisher=Edward Elgar |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110724151936/http://publishing.eur.nl/ir/repub/asset/782/TOWSE%20EBOOK_pages0103-0113.pdf |archivedate=2011-07-24 |df= }}</ref> The extent to which other treatments have been employed is subjective.
== See also == * [[Paradox of toil]]
==References== {{More footnotes|date=April 2009}}
{{reflist}}
==External links== * {{cite magazine |url=http://www.newyorker.com/archive/2003/07/07/030707ta_talk_surowiecki |title=What Ails Us |author=James Surowiecki |magazine=The New Yorker |date=July 7, 2003}} * {{cite web |url=http://www.infomanagementcenter.com/enewsletter/200608/baumol.htm |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081007193556/http://www.infomanagementcenter.com/enewsletter/200608/baumol.htm |archivedate=October 7, 2008 |title=Baumol's Disease - Is there a Cure? |author=Bill Hackos |author2=Charles Dowdell}} * {{cite web |url=http://www.dailyfinance.com/story/taxes/americas-economic-illness-baumols-dis/19752285/?source=patrick.net#articleHeader |title=America's Economic Malady: A Bad Case of 'Baumol's Disease' |author=Charles Hugh Smith |publisher=DailyFinance.com |date=December 11, 2010 |access-date=December 14, 2010 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101217074828/http://www.dailyfinance.com/story/taxes/americas-economic-illness-baumols-dis/19752285/?source=patrick.net#articleHeader |archive-date=December 17, 2010 |dead-url=yes |df=mdy-all }} * {{cite journal |url=http://www.ssrn.com/abstract=1531602 |title=Creativity and the Positive Reading of Baumol Cost Disease |last=Sparviero |first=Sergio |last2=Preston |first2=Paschal |journal=The Service Industries Journal |volume=30 |number=12 |date=December 1, 2010}} * {{cite journal |url=http://www.ssrn.com/abstract=1531555 |title=Creative Inputs as the Cause of Baumol's Cost Disease: The Example of Media Services. |last=Preston |first=Paschal |last2=Sparviero |first2=Sergio |journal=Journal of Media Economics |volume=22 |number=4 |pages=239-252 |date=December 30, 2009}}

{{Orphan|date=May 2018}}
{{Infobox person | name = Bill Huang | native_name = {{lang|zh-Hans-CN|黄晓庆}} | birth_name = | other_names = | death_date = <!-- {{death date and age|}} --> | death_place = | death_cause = | nationality = | ancestor = | ethnicity = | education = [[Huazhong University of Science & Technology]], [[University of Illinois]] | occupation = [[serial entrepreneur]] | agent = | known_for = [[CloudMinds]] | notable_works = | television = | party = | movement = | religion = | relatives = | signature = | signature_alt = | signature_size = }} '''Bill Huang''' ({{zh|c=黄晓庆|p=Huáng Xiǎoqìng}}) is a Chinese [[serial entrepreneur]].<ref>{{cite news|title=助力學子科學夢想 ——“千人計劃”專家走進電子科大|url=http://news.takungpao.com.hk/mainland/topnews/2016-12/3407542.html|accessdate=31 August 2017|agency=大公報}}</ref> He was the leader in [[China Mobile]] Research Institution in 2007.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://news.xinhuanet.com/info/2017-06/03/c_136336591.htm|title=新华网|accessdate=31 August 2017|work=news.xinhuanet.com}}</ref> In 2015, Huang founded [[CloudMinds]] Inc., the first cloud-based intelligent robot technology and operating company in the world.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.cloudminds.com/details/rJeusTjVl.html|title=达闼 中国官方网站|accessdate=31 August 2017|work=www.cloudminds.com}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://news.xinhuanet.com/info/2017-06/03/c_136336591.htm|title=开启手机“硬件开放”时代的梦想家-新华网|accessdate=31 August 2017|work=news.xinhuanet.com}}</ref>
== Life and career == Bill Huang graduated from [[Huazhong University of Science & Technology]] with a bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering. After 2 years studying at the [[University of Illinois]], he received master's degree in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science.<ref>{{cite web|title=黄晓庆 - 中国留学人员广州科技交流会|url=https://www.ocs-gz.gov.cn/news/detail/4761|website=www.ocs-gz.gov.cn|accessdate=31 August 2017}}</ref>
Huang entered [[Bell Laboratories]] to work on researches in Asynchronous Transfer Mode in 1990. In 1994, he joined Unitech Telecom and became the co-founder of [[UTStarcom|UTStarcom Holdings Corp.]] a year later. After that, Huang developed the [[operating system]] WACOS.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://mall.cnki.net/magazine/Article/DXJS200604038.htm|title=让数字电视随心看——访UT斯达康高级副总裁兼首席技术官黄晓庆-《电信技术》2006年04期-中国知网|accessdate=31 August 2017|work=mall.cnki.net}}</ref>
In 1996, Huang put forward the "Network is the Switch" soft switch concept. That same year, he co-established the International Soft switch Consortium (ISC) and developed the first mobile soft switch system in the world and the first carrier-class streaming media exchange and IPTV system.<ref name="labs">{{Cite web|url=http://labs.chinamobile.com/members/info_7|title=中国移动研究院|accessdate=31 August 2017|work=labs.chinamobile.com}}</ref>
With the aim to build a research and development center like Bell Labs, Huang joined [[China Mobile]] in 2007. He was the leader in China Mobile Research Institution, and later proposed the concept of constructing the three infrastructures (network, applications and terminals) of the next-generation mobile internet for the carriers. Besides, he built China Mobile "Big Cloud" cloud computing platform. The platform carried out development of cloud computing and big data platform, supporting the world's largest operator of public and private clouds construction and services.<ref name="labs"/>
In 2012, Huang created a new architecture for building intelligent robotics system, the cloud-based robot system. It contains the idea to split the robot into three parts, cloud, mobile network and terminal, which forms complete servicing robots that can assist companies and families. <ref>{{cite web|title=30载通信老将 要做IOT时代运营商 软银富士康加盟|url=http://www.sohu.com/a/126873293_115978|website=www.sohu.com|accessdate=31 August 2017|date=21 February 2017}}</ref>
In 2015, Huang founded [[CloudMinds]] Inc., the first cloud-based [[intelligent robot]] technology and operating company in the world.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.cloudminds.com/details/rJeusTjVl.html|title=达闼 中国官方网站|accessdate=31 August 2017|work=www.cloudminds.com|language=en}}</ref>
== Achievements == Bill Huang has received many awards throughout his career. He was selected as ''Talent 1000'' (千人计划) Plan Experts.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://1000plan.org/qrjh/article/598|title=黄晓庆_千人计划_千人计划_千人计划网|accessdate=31 August 2017|work=1000plan.org}}</ref> In 2007, he was listed on 100 Most Influential Persons in the Chinese Mobility Industry.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://tech.qq.com/a/20080123/000296_3.htm?client=tim&ptlang=2052&source&ADUIN=909610154&ADSESSION=1498107229&ADTAG=CLIENT.QQ.5525_.0&ADPUBNO=26689|title=2007中国手机业最有影响力100人颁奖典礼_科技_腾讯网|accessdate=31 August 2017|work=tech.qq.com}}</ref>Huang received "Eleventh Five-Year" National Science and Technology Award for Outstanding Contributions on Implementation in 2011.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.most.gov.cn/tztg/201102/W020110217614623128085.pdf|title=中华人民共和国“十一五”国家科技计划执行突出贡献奖|accessdate=2017-06-25|author=|date=|publisher=}}</ref>In 2016, he received IEEE CQR Chairman's Award, which was the first time that a Chinese CEO to achieve so.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://tech.xinmin.cn/2016/05/13/30011951.html|title=首位中国企业技术领袖获IEEE CQR主席大奖_科技_新民网|accessdate=31 August 2017|work=tech.xinmin.cn}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.1000plan.org/lianyihui2/news/405|title=“千人计划”专家联谊会|accessdate=31 August 2017|work=www.1000plan.org}}</ref>
== References == <references />
{{DEFAULTSORT:Huang, Bill}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Chinese businesspeople]] [[Category:Year of birth missing (living people)]] [[Category:Huazhong University of Science and Technology alumni]] [[Category:University of Illinois at Urbana–Champaign alumni]]

{{About|the electronics company in the [[Philippines]]|the digital optical disc format|CD-R|other uses of "CDR"|CDR (disambiguation)}} {{Infobox company | name = CD-R King | logo = File:CD-R King logo.svg | type = [[Privately held company|Private]] | founder = | area_served = [[Philippines]] | key_people = | industry = [[Retail]] | genre = | products = [[Consumer electronics]], [[Home appliance|Appliance]]s | services = | revenue = | operating_income = | net_income = | owner = | num_employees = | parent = | divisions = {{plainlist| * STARK * California ECO-BIKE * Mobile King * Kenko World }} | subsid = | foundation = Early 2000s<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=http://www.reviewstream.com/reviews/?p=47665|title=CD-R King review|website=www.reviewstream.com|access-date=November 16, 2016}}</ref> | location_city = [[Quezon City]] | location_country = [[Philippines]] | location = | origins = | slogan = | homepage = [http://www.cdrking.com/ CD-R King] }} '''CD-R King''' (styled as '''cd-r king''' or '''CD-R KING''') is a Filipino retail chain that sells discounted computer parts and gadgets, electronic appliances, and accessories.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://cebudailynews.inquirer.net/28715/cd-r-king-opens-biggest-branch-in-cebu|title=CD-R King opens biggest branch in Cebu|last=PR|date=May 3, 2014|newspaper=Cebu Daily News|access-date=November 16, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.geeky-guide.com/2009/10/philippines-cd-r-king.html|title=[Philippines] CD-R King|website=Geeky Guide|access-date=November 16, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.yugatech.com/toys-gadgets/10-cool-gadgets-that-you-can-buy-from-cd-r-king/|title=Yugatech - CD-R King|last=|first=|date=|website=Yugatech|publisher=|access-date=November 16, 2016}}</ref> CD-R King's branches are often located in malls, where they compete against higher-end electronics retailers.<ref name=":0"/><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.cdrking.com/branches/|title=CD-R King|website=www.cdrking.com|access-date=November 16, 2016}}</ref>
== History == CD-R King has initially been known for selling recordable media in bulk at a fraction of the cost since the early 2000s, but has since expanded their line to other products in response to changing market and technological trends over the years, even going so far as to offering goods which have little or nothing to do with optical media or information technology in general, (e.g. ornaments and other such accessories; this prompted the introduction of their branding divisions like STARK for appliances, California ECO-BIKE for [[electric bicycle]]s,<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://lifestyle.inquirer.net/191153/cd-r-king-affirms-efforts-to-help-clean-the-environment-through-california-e-bikes/|title=CD-R King affirms efforts to help clean the environment through California E-bikes|website=Philippine Daily Inquirer|access-date=November 16, 2016}}</ref> Mobile King for [[cell phones]], and Kenko World for their cell phone accessories and health and beauty products). Most of CD-R King's products are sourced from [[original design manufacturer]]s from [[China]], [[Taiwan]] and other countries, and are sold under [[Store brand|their own brand]]. Many CD-R King-branded products are re-branded versions of the same or similar products sold in parallel by their manufacturers.
It since became the popular gadget store in Metro Manila and spread out to [[Luzon]], then to [[Cebu City]], and later has branches nationwide with more than 350 branches (excluding Kenko World branches) in all major shopping mall chains in the country.
===Copyright concerns=== The company's operations gained controversy as the [[Optical Media Board]] accused CD-R King in 2008 of facilitating [[copyright infringement]] through inexpensive media supplied by the company,<ref name=":0" /><ref name=":1">{{Cite news|url=http://www.alleba.com/blog/2008/02/07/cd-r-king-pirate-kings-of-smuggling/|title=CD-R King - Pirate Kings of Smuggling?|date=February 7, 2016|newspaper=Alleba Blog|access-date=November 16, 2016}}</ref> imposing a P1.5 million penalty for failing to produce permits for some of its optical media disc importations.<ref name=":1" />
In 2013, [[Globe Telecom]] has signed agreements with several major retailers of gadgets and IT equipment, including CD-R King, in a bid to curb the sale of illegal repeaters or signal boosters in the country. The agreement binds retailers from selling signal boosters that do not comply with the specifications set by the [[National Telecommunications Commission (Philippines)|National Telecommunications Commission]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://news.abs-cbn.com/business/09/23/13/cd-r-king-retailers-stop-selling-illegal-signal-boosters|title=CD-R King, retailers to stop selling illegal signal boosters|last=|first=|work=ABS-CBN News|access-date=November 16, 2016}}</ref>
== Products == [[File:CD-R King Headphone.jpg|thumb|A CD-R King-branded headphone.]] CD-R King sells various products under their CD-R King, Stark and Kenko World brands, in addition to licensed merchandise based on [[Disney]] properties among other things. Aside from optical storage media, they also sell cellular phones, electronic gadgets, accessories, appliances, electric bicycles<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.philstar.com/motoring/2015/04/25/1446273/cd-r-king-affirms-effort-helping-clean-environment-through-california-e|title=CD-R King affirms effort in helping clean environment through California E-bikes|newspaper=The Philippine Star|access-date=November 16, 2016}}</ref> and even health and beauty products.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://ph.news.yahoo.com/photos/16-things-you-can-buy-at-cd-r-king-1366703900-slideshow/|work=Yahoo! Philippines|title=16 things you can buy at CD-R King|access-date=November 16, 2016}}</ref>
== Branches == With around 350 branches in all major leading malls, they are located in these mall chains: * [[SM Supermalls|SM Malls]] and Savemore * [[Ayala Malls]] * [[Robinsons Malls|Robinson Malls]] * [[Gaisano Malls]] (except JS Gaisano and Gaisano Center Malls) * [[KCC Malls]] * Xentro Malls * [[CityMall (Philippines)|CityMall]] (except [[CityMall Tetuan-Zamboanga]] and CityMall Iloilo) * [[Puregold]] (major branches only) * Star Mall * Festival Mall * [[Market! Market!]] * Yashano Mall * Malabon City Square * University of Santo Tomas * Roque Ruaño
==Reception== Despite gaining popularity for offering gadgets and computer accessories at discounted prices, the company has gained a somewhat dubious reputation for its build quality, with some items breaking down shortly after purchase.<ref name="Olandres">{{cite web|url=http://www.yugatech.com/toys-gadgets/does-cdr-king-have-a-reputation-problem/|title=Does CDR-King have a reputation problem?|last=Olandres|first=Abe|date=16 May 2011|work=Yugatech|accessdate=5 March 2018}}</ref>
== See also == * [[Dick Smith (retailer)|Dick Smith]] *[[Octagon Computer Superstore]] *[[Silicon Valley Computer Group Philippines|Silicon Valley]]
== References == {{Reflist|}}
== External links == * [http://www.cdrking.com/ CD-R King Official Website] * [http://stark.cdrking.com/ STARK] * [http://www.californiaecobike.com/homepage.php?index=home&title=E-Bike%20Website California ECO Bike] * [http://mobile.cdrking.com/homepage.php?title=Mobile-King Mobile King] * [http://www.kenkoworld.com/homepage.php#tabs|Tabs_Group_name:Tab_1_name Kenko World]
[[Category:Retail companies of the Philippines]] [[Category:Philippine brands]] [[Category:Electronic component distributors]] [[Category:Home computer hardware companies]] [[Category:Companies based in Quezon City]]

{{For|the 1992 Hong Kong film|Casino Tycoon (film)}} {{Infobox video game |title = Casino Tycoon |image = Casino tycoon coverart.jpg |developer = [[Cat Daddy Games]] |publisher = [[Monte Cristo (company)|Monte Cristo]] and [[Davilex Games]] |designer = |engine = |released = {{vgrelease|US|December 15, 2001}} |genre = [[Business simulation game|Business simulation]] |modes = [[Single player]] |platforms = [[Personal computer|PC]] }} '''Casino Tycoon''' is a tycoon type of game where players aspire from a small unknown to a [[tycoon]] in the casino business.
== Game features == This game features characters such as Marlon Brando from ''[[The Godfather]]''. One mission is for players to become the first casino to attain [[Star (classification)|Five-star rating]] or make 50,000 pounds. Players control all aspects of the casino, including hiring staff, buying casinos, and managing the day-to-day operations. The basic aim of the game is to own and manage a casino.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.gamesmeter.nl/game/4077 | title = Casino Tycoon (2001) | publisher = GamesMeter.nl | accessdate = 25 July 2016 | language = Dutch }}</ref>
== Reception == {{Video game reviews | MC = 52/100<ref name=MC/> | IGN = 6.2/10<ref name=IGN/> }}
''Casino Tycoon'' received mixed to negative reviews from critics upon release. On [[Metacritic]], the game holds a score of 52/100 based on 4 reviews, indicating "mixed or average reviews."<ref name=MC>{{Cite web |url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/pc/casino-tycoon |title=Casino Tycoon for PC Reviews |publisher=[[Metacritic]] |accessdate=14 December 2017}}</ref>
Staci Krause of [[IGN]] rated it 6.2/10 and wrote that the game, while initially fun, becomes too easy to have long-term entertainment value.<ref name=IGN>{{cite web|url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2001/12/18/casino-tycoon|title=Casino Tycoon|last=Krause|first=Staci|work=[[IGN]]|date=2001-12-17|accessdate=2016-11-03}}</ref>
== References == {{reflist}} {{casino-videogame-stub}} [[Category:2001 video games]] [[Category:Casino video games]] [[Category:Video games developed in the United States]] [[Category:Windows games]] [[Category:Windows-only games]] [[Category:Business simulation games]]

revision.text:
[[File:Verner Eisby - Inventor of Corona treatment.JPG|thumb|right|Verner Eisby, a Danish engineer, the inventor of corona treatment.]]
'''Corona treatment''' (sometimes referred to as '''air plasma''') is a surface modification technique that uses a low temperature [[corona discharge]] plasma to impart changes in the properties of a surface. The corona [[Plasma (physics)|plasma]] is generated by the application of high voltage to an electrode that has a sharp tip. The plasma forms at the tip. A linear array of electrodes is often used to create a curtain of corona plasma. Materials such as plastics, cloth, or paper may be passed through the corona plasma curtain in order to change the surface energy of the material. All materials have an inherent [[surface energy]]. Surface treatment systems are available for virtually any surface format including dimensional objects, sheets and roll goods that are handled in a web format. Corona treatment is a widely used surface treatment method in the plastic film, extrusion, and converting industries.
==History== The corona treatment was invented by the Danish engineer Verner Eisby in 1951. Verner had been asked by one of his customers if he could find a solution which would make it possible to print on plastic. Verner found that there were already a couple of ways to accomplish this. One was a gas flame method and the other was a spark generating method, both of which were crude and uncontrollable and did not produce a homogeneous product. Verner came up with the theory that a high frequency corona discharge would provide both a more efficient and controllable method to treat the surface. Exhaustive experiments proved him to be correct. Verner's company, Vetaphone, obtained patent rights for the new corona treatment system.
==Materials== Many [[plastics]], such as [[polyethylene]] and [[polypropylene]], have chemically inert and nonporous surfaces with low [[surface tension]]s causing them to be non-receptive to bonding with printing [[ink]]s, [[coating]]s, and [[adhesive]]s. Although results are invisible to the naked eye, surface treating modifies surfaces to improve adhesion.
Polyethylene, polypropylene, [[nylon]], [[Vinyl polymer|vinyl]], [[PVC]], [[Polyethylene terephthalate|PET]], metalized surfaces, foils, paper, and [[paperboard]] stocks are commonly treated by this method. It is safe, economical, and delivers high line speed throughput. Corona treatment is also suitable for the treatment of [[Injection molding|injection]] and [[Blow molding|blow]] molded parts, and is capable of treating multiple surfaces and difficult parts with a single pass. <ref>{{cite journal | last = Sellin | first =Noeli | title =Surface composition analysis of PP films treated by corona discharge | journal = Materials Research | publisher = | date =2003 | pages = | volume = 6 | issue = 2 | url =http://www.scielo.br/scielo.php?pid=S1516-14392003000200009&script=sci_arttext&tlng=es | isbn = | access-date =September 21, 2018 }}</ref><ref>{{cite journal | last = Suzer | first =S | title =XPS and water contact angle measurements on aged and corona‐treated PP | journal = Applied Polymer Science | publisher = | date =1999 | pages =1846-1850 | volume = 74 | issue = 7 | url =http://repository.bilkent.edu.tr/bitstream/handle/11693/25174/bilkent-research-paper.pdf?sequence=1 | isbn = | access-date =September 21, 2018 }}</ref>
==Equipment== Corona discharge equipment consists of a [[high-frequency]] power generator, a [[high-voltage]] [[transformer]], a stationary [[electrode]], and a treater ground roll. Standard utility electrical power is converted into higher frequency power which is then supplied to the treater station. The treater station applies this power through [[ceramic]] or [[metal]] electrodes over an air gap onto the material’s surface.
Two basic corona treater stations are used in [[extrusion coating]] applications—''Bare Roll'' and ''Covered Roll''. On a bare roll treater station, the dielectric encapsulates the electrode. On a covered roll station, it encapsulates the treater base roll. The treater consists of an electrode and a base roll in both stations. In theory a covered roll treater is generally used to treat non-conductive webs, and a Bare Roll treater is used to treat conductive webs. However, manufacturers who treat a variety of substrates on the same production line may choose to use a Bare Roll treater.<ref>{{cite web | title = Corona Treating for Coating Applications | url = http://www.faustel.com/technical-library/corona-treating-for-coating-applications}}</ref>
==Pre-treatment== Many substrates provide a better bonding surface when they are treated at the time they are produced. This is called “pre-treatment.” The effects of corona treatment diminish over time. Therefore many surfaces will require a second “bump” treatment at the time they are converted to ensure bonding with printing inks, coatings, and adhesives.
==Other technologies== Other technologies used for surface treatment include in-line atmospheric (air) plasma, flame plasma, and chemical plasma systems.
===Atmospheric plasma treatment=== [[Atmospheric-pressure plasma]] treatment is very similar to corona treatment but there are a few differences between them. Both treatments may use one or more high voltage electrodes which charge the surrounding blown gas molecules and ionizes them. However in atmospheric plasma systems, the overall plasma density is much greater which enhances the rate and degree to which the ionized molecules are incorporated onto a materials' surface. An increased rate of ion bombardment occurs which may result in stronger material bonding traits depending on the gas molecules used in the process. Atmospheric plasma treatment technology also eliminates a possibility of treatment on a material's non-treated side; also known as backside treatment.
===Flame plasma=== Flame plasma treaters generate more heat than other treating processes, but materials treated through this method tend to have a longer shelf-life. These plasma systems are different from air plasma systems because flame plasma occurs when flammable gas and surrounding air are combusted into an intense blue flame. Objects’ surfaces are [[Polarizability|polarized]] from the flame plasma affecting the distribution of the surface’s [[electron]]s in an [[oxidation]] form. This treatment requires higher temperatures so many of the materials that are treated with a flame plasma can be damaged.
===Chemical plasma=== Chemical plasma is based on the combination of air plasma and flame plasma. Much like air plasma, chemical plasma fields are generated from electrically charged air. But, instead of air, chemical plasma relies on a mixture of other gases depositing various [[chemical group]]s onto the treated surface.
== See also == * [[Flame treatment]] * [[List of plasma (physics) articles]] * [[Plasma activation]] * [[Polymeric surface]] * [[Surface finishing]]
==References== {{Reflist}}
==External links== * [http://www.vetaphone.com/technology/corona-treatment/ Explanation of Corona Treatment - By the Inventor, Vetaphone]
{{DEFAULTSORT:Corona Treatment}} [[Category:Industrial processes]] [[Category:Plastics industry]]

{{about||the mathematician|Dan Voiculescu (mathematician)|the composer|Dan Voiculescu (composer)}} {{Infobox Politician | honorific-prefix = | name = Dan Voiculescu | honorific-suffix = | image = | imagesize = | smallimage = | caption = | order = | office = [[Senate of Romania|Senator]] | term_start = December 13, 2004 | term_end = December 14, 2008 | predecessor = | successor = | constituency = 42 ([[Bucharest]]) | office2 = [[Senate of Romania|Senator]] | term_start2 = December 15, 2008 | term_end2 = June 25, 2012 | predecessor2 = | successor2 = | office3 = [[Senate of Romania|Senator]] | term_start3 = January 22, 2013 | term_end3 = January 28, 2013 | predecessor3 = | successor3 = | constituency3 = 8 ([[Bucharest]]) | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1946|09|25}} | birth_place = [[Bucharest]], [[Romania]] | nationality = [[Romania]]n | spouse = Liana Voiculescu ([[Concubinage]]) | alma_mater = | religion = [[Romanian Orthodox Church|Romanian Orthodoxy]] | party = [[Conservative Party (Romania)|Conservative Party]] | website = }}
'''Dan Voiculescu''' ({{IPA-ro|ˈdan vojkuˈlesku}}; born September 25, 1946) is a [[Romania]]n politician and businessman. He is the founder and former president of the [[Romanian Humanist Party]], later renamed the Conservative Party (PC). He was a [[Romanian Senate|senator]] from 2004 until his resignation in 2012.
Dan Voiculescu was one of the richest men in Romania, with a fortune estimated at 1.5 - 1.6 billion euros, according to Top 300 Richest Romanian People launched by the Capital magazine on October 2009. The [[Intact Media Group]], founded by Dan Voiculescu, includes several major television stations (most notably [[Antena 1 (Romania)|Antena 1]] and [[Antena 3 (Romania)|Antena 3]]), radio stations, as well as top newspapers and magazines (most notably [[Jurnalul Naţional]] and [[Gazeta Sporturilor]]). According to Top 300 issued by Capital,<ref>[http://www.mediafax.ro/cultura-media/top-300-capital-familia-voiculescu-si-dinu-patriciu-cei-mai-bogati-romani-din-mass-media-4988595]</ref> developing televisions and launching GSP TV and Radio station ZU, as well as strengthening the print media, have been among the main directions that have marked the group's businesses in 2008.
In August 2014, Voiculescu was found guilty and sentenced to ten years in prison for money laundering.<ref>http://anticoruptie.hotnews.ro/ancheta-7475495-dosarul-dan-voiculescu.htm</ref>
==Early life== Voiculescu was born in [[Bucharest]], in a family of modest means, who lived in the Bariera Vergului neighborhood. For his secondary studies, he went to the [[Emil Racoviţă]] High School.<ref name=foundation>{{ro icon}} [http://www.aoar.ro/cv/voicules.htm "Preşedinte Fondator - Dan Voiculescu"] {{webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20000518013126/http://www.aoar.ro/cv/voicules.htm |date=2000-05-18 }}, biography at Dan Voiculescu Humanist Foundation</ref> Starting in 1969, he studied at the [[Bucharest Academy of Economic Studies|Academy of Economic Studies]] (ASE) in [[Bucharest]], obtaining a [[Bachelor of Arts|B.A.]] in 1974, and a [[Ph.D]] in 1977.<ref name=bio>[http://www.danvoiculescu.net/en/ Dan Voiculescu web site] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070523073155/http://www.danvoiculescu.net/en/ |date=May 23, 2007 }}</ref> In 1991, he obtained a Ph.D. in economics from the [[educational accreditation|unaccredited]] [[Pacific Western University (Hawaii)]], in [[Honolulu, Hawaii]], and became a professor at ASE.<ref name=foundation/>
According to the autobiography published on the official website, he was born in a modest family, his father being a plumber and his mother a housewife. He grew up in the Bucharest neighborhood of Bariera Vergului, near the 23 August skating rink, where he practiced ice hockey. In 1969 he fulfilled the military service in a military unit in Focsani.
Before the 1989 revolution, he lived in a state rental house and drove a Dacia purchased in installments. Working in the foreign trade, of his allowance of $7 per day, he was able – according to the same autobiography - to gather over 21 years, 30 thousand dollars, which he deposited to BRCE and have been the starting capital of the GRIVCO group.
==Political activities== {{Expand section|date=December 2009}} In 1991, Voiculescu founded the Humanist Party of Romania, which changed its name to the Conservative Party (PC) in May 2005. Under Voiculescu's leadership, the party also markedly changed its doctrine to embrace [[Conservatism|conservative]] values in line with the views of the [[European People's Party]] in the [[European Parliament]].<ref>[http://www.epp-ed.eu/Press/showpr.asp?PRControlDocTypeID=1&PRControlID=3732&PRContentID=6935&PRContentLG=en "EPP-ED-Bureau Meeting in Bucharest: 'Romania must do its job'"], June 2, 2005.</ref> The PC, however, did not join the European People's Party.
The PC, then called the PUR, supported the [[Social Democratic Party (Romania)|Social Democratic Party]] (PSD)-led government from 2000 to 2004, and ran in coalition with the PSD in the 2004 parliamentary and presidential elections.
The PC was also part of the ruling coalition led by Prime Minister [[Călin Popescu-Tăriceanu]] from December 2004 until the party withdrew in 2006. According to [[Freedom House]], one reason the government of Popescu-Tăriceanu included the small PC, which received support from only 2 percent of the population, was due to the strength of Voiculescu family's Antenna 1 television station.<ref>http://www.freedomhouse.org/inc/content/pubs/nit/inc_country_detail.cfm?page=47&nit=387&year=2006&pf</ref> [[Thomas Gerard Gallagher|Tom Gallagher]], a Romania specialist at [[Bradford University]], stated in January 2005, shortly after the PC entered the government, that Voiculescu "is a potentially major problem if the government decides to introduce legislation that will challenge vested interests which have profited through the questionable sale of state assets."<ref>[http://hnn.us/roundup/entries/9594.html "Dan Voiculescu's Tainted Past Dogs Humanist Party In Romania"], ''[[Financial Times]]'', January 10, 2005.</ref>
PC ran in a coalition with PSD in the 2008 legislative elections, and Voiculescu was elected senator in a Bucharest district.
As member of the [[Romanian Senate]], Voiculescu has been strong in his opposition to Romanian President [[Traian Băsescu]], who he states has exceeded constitutional boundaries and abused power. In March, 2007, he established a special commission within the Parliament to investigate Băsescu's actions as president and sponsored the legislation in the Parliament that led to a national referendum over whether Băsescu should remain in office.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://english.hotnews.ro/MPs-decide-President-Basescu-breached-Constitution-articol_pda_1_-1_44554.htm |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2007-03-21 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070921100713/http://english.hotnews.ro/MPs-decide-President-Basescu-breached-Constitution-articol_pda_1_-1_44554.htm |archivedate=2007-09-21 |df= }}</ref><ref>[http://www.economist.com/countries/Romania/profile.cfm?folder=Profile-Political%20Forces Economist.com | Country Briefings: Romania<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> Voiculescu was also strongly opposed to former Minister of Justice [[Monica Macovei]].
In April 2007, the Parliamentary Committee led by Senator Dan Voiculescu managed, for the first time in the post-revolutionary Romania, the suspension of an acting president. The report drawn up by the "Voiculescu Committee" was adopted in the Romanian Parliament, with 322 votes "for" and 108 "against"; President Traian Băsescu was thus suspended from his function.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://stiri.kappa.ro/politica/19-04-2007/traian-basescu-suspendat-128644.html |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2009-12-12 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110718225754/http://stiri.kappa.ro/politica/19-04-2007/traian-basescu-suspendat-128644.html |archivedate=2011-07-18 |df= }}</ref>
Voiculescu opposed a draft law proposed by Justice Minister Monica Macovei and supported by the European Commission to set up a special agency for checking assets declarations for MPs and other senior officials. He subsequently supported a version characterized as "watered down" by the international media.<ref>http://www.evz.ro/categ.php?catid=7 {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070321043642/http://www.evz.ro/categ.php?catid=7 |date=March 21, 2007 }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.sar.org.ro/files/romania_final.pdf|title=Romania|last=MUNGIU-PIPPIDI|first=ALINA|date=|website=Societatea Academica Din Romania|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref>
On September 2007, Dan Voiculescu resigned from his senator function as a form of protest against the blocking in the Romanian Parliament, of various important social laws. They were about promoting his projects on extending the contracts of tenants in the nationalized houses, reducing VAT on food, solidarity fund for pensioners and non-taxation of reinvested profits, legislation designed to bring more money to pensioners with low incomes, to lower prices on basic food or assist companies to reinvest their profits.
On November 2008, by occasion of the first elections held in the plurality system, Dan Voiculescu returned to the Romanian Parliament, obtaining 21,708 votes in the 8th college in Bucharest, and in December 2008 he was elected Vice-President of the Senate of Romania, with 83 votes for and 2 against.
=== Voiculescu's Law ===
Voiculescu initiated a bill, now named after him, that allows tenants of buildings that were [[nationalized]] during communism to stay in them, while the former owners receive only financial compensation. After a long legislative and constitutional battle, president Băsescu signed it into law in 2009, even though he and his party opposed it. [[Emil Boc]]'s government however did not apply it, and was sued by tenants' associations.<ref>{{ro icon}} [http://www.sfin.ro/articol_15678/guvernul_dat_in_judecata_pentru_neaplicarea_%E2%80%9Elegii_voiculescu%E2%80%9C.html Guvernul, dat în judecată pentru neaplicarea „Legii Voiculescu“] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090325095513/http://www.sfin.ro/articol_15678/guvernul_dat_in_judecata_pentru_neaplicarea_%E2%80%9Elegii_voiculescu%E2%80%9C.html |date=2009-03-25 }}</ref>
==Secret police involvement== Although he denied it for several years, in 2006 Voiculescu admitted having been a collaborator of the [[Securitate]],<ref>Craig S. Smith, [http://www.iht.com/articles/2006/12/11/news/spooks.php?page=1 "Cold War specter lingers in Eastern Europe"], ''[[International Herald Tribune]]'', December 12, 2006.</ref> Romania's [[Communist Romania|communist-era]] internal intelligence service, after information to this effect was released publicly by Romania's National Council for the Study of the Securitate Archives ([[CNSAS]]). At the time, Voiculescu was named to be a Vice Premier in the Popescu-Tăriceanu government, but was ultimately not allowed to take the position because of his involvement with the communist secret police.<ref>{{ro icon}} [http://www.bbc.co.uk/romanian/forum/story/2006/06/060616_voiculescu_securitate_cnsas.shtml ''Dan Voiculescu şi fosta Securitate''], "Dan Voiculescu and the former Securitate", [[BBC News]], June 16, 2006.</ref><ref>[[Jim Compton]], [http://seattletimes.nwsource.com/html/opinion/2003316215_suncompton22.html "The struggle for civil society in post-revolution Romania"], ''[[The Seattle Times]]'', October 22, 2006.</ref>
CNSAS revealed that Voiculescu acted as an informer for the Securitate by the names of "Felix" and "Mircea". He later claimed that he only collaborated "two or three times" for economic espionage.,<ref>[http://www.iht.com/articles/2006/12/11/news/spooks.php?page=2 "Cold War specter lingers in Eastern Europe"], ''[[International Herald Tribune]]'', December 12, 2006.</ref> and he had cooperated with the Securitate as "all Romanians did" during the communist period. The latter statement drew criticism from journalist [[Cristian Tudor Popescu]], who wrote that "Mr. Voiculescu knows very well there were millions of Romanians who didn't have anything to do with the Securitate and others who simply refused to work for it."<ref>Razvan Amariei, [http://www.csees.net/?page=country_analyses&country_id=6&ca_id=2181 "Transitions Online: The Meaning of "Political""] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070928171038/http://www.csees.net/?page=country_analyses&country_id=6&ca_id=2181 |date=2007-09-28 }}, The Centre for SouthEast European Studies, June 26, 2006.</ref> Voiculescu denies, however, having been an official collaborator (with a signed agreement) or an officer of the Securitate and is appealing the CNSAS' ruling to that effect. He has said he will resign from the Senate if the verdict is not overturned on appeal. He blamed the initial findings against him on Băsescu, who, according to Voiculescu, launched a campaign to undermine him.<ref>Ana Şerban, [http://www.nineoclock.ro/index.php?page=detalii&categorie=politics&id=20070320-507465 "Voiculescu’s appeal against CNSAS decision delayed in Court"], ''Nine O'Clock'', March 21, 2007.</ref>
Tom Gallagher wrote in a 2004 paper<ref>[http://www.ce-review.org/00/35/gallagher35.html Emerging from the Shadows]</ref> that it is supposed that Dan Voiculescu held the rank of General within the intelligence service before Romania's 1989 anti-communist revolution, but nothing has been proved till now. [[Ziua]] newspaper commented however that if Voiculescu was a "covert general" this fact would be extremely hard to prove; official records show that Voiculescu was a reserve army [[sub-lieutenant]].<ref>[http://hotnews.ro/articol_5394-Dan-Voiculescu-a-fost-general-in-serviciul-secret-al-lui-Ceausescu.htm "Dan Voiculescu a fost general in serviciul secret al lui Ceauşescu"], ''[[Ziua]]'', September 11, 2004.</ref>
In July 2006, Camelia Voiculescu, the owner of ''Jurnalul Naţional'', asked for editor [[Dorin Tudoran]]'s resignation,<ref>{{ro icon}} [http://www.hotnews.ro/articol_52697-Camelia-Voiculescu-ii-cere-lui-Tuca-sa-l-concedieze-pe-Dorin-Tudoran.htm "Camelia Voiculescu îi cere lui Tuca să-l concedieze pe Dorin Tudoran"], HotNews.ro, July 20, 2006.</ref><ref>{{ro icon}} Dorin Tudoran, [http://www.jurnalul.ro/articole/16117/stimate-dle-marius-tuca "Stimate dle Marius Tuca"], ''Jurnalul Naţional'', July 23, 2006.</ref> following an editorial in which he criticized her father, Dan Voiculescu, for his past association with the Securitate.<ref>{{ro icon}} Dorin Tudoran, [http://www.jurnalul.ro/articole/16953/felix-mircea-si-dorin "Felix, Mircea şi Dorin"], ''Jurnalul Naţional'', July 11, 2006.</ref>
A verdict however unattested by the Justice, according to the law. The case is pending.
On March 5, 2010, the Court of Appeal upheld that Dan Voiculescu has collaborated with the Securitate during the communist regime, having the conspiratorial name “Felix”. Subsequently, the decision was appealed to the Supreme Court, which upheld the Court of Appeal solution.
==Corruption investigation==
The Romanian National Anti-corruption Department (DNA) announced on April 3, 2007, that it was investigating Voiculescu, his daughter, and several business associates for [[money laundering]], with regard to funds obtained through the national lottery. Voiculescu denied all the charges, claiming the investigation was politically motivated and that the transactions were legal.<ref>[http://english.hotnews.ro/Political-leader-Dan-Voiculescu-others-under-criminal-inquiry-for-money-laundering-articol_44648.htm "Political leader Dan Voiculescu, others under criminal inquiry for money laundering"], HotNews.ro, April 3, 2007.</ref>
Voiculescu has been accused of other corruption scandals, including an alleged scheme whereby [[Grivco]], a company he owned, bought [[electrical energy]] from the state-controlled [[Rovinari]] complex, and sold the energy back to Electrica, another state-controlled company, at a large profit.<ref name=sercan>{{ro icon}} Emilia Şercan, [http://www.expres.ro/article.php?artid=298384 "Voiculescu, piratul kilowaţilor"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070930043840/http://www.expres.ro/article.php?artid=298384 |date=2007-09-30 }}, ''[[Evenimentul Zilei]]'', March 29, 2007.</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://english.hotnews.ro/What-the-newspapers-say-March-29-2007-articol_44608.htm |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2007-04-07 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070929111530/http://english.hotnews.ro/What-the-newspapers-say-March-29-2007-articol_44608.htm |archivedate=2007-09-29 |df= }}</ref><ref>[http://www.iht.com/articles/ap/2007/04/03/europe/EU-GEN-Romania-Opposition-Politician.php Romanian media mogul and politician investigated on money laundering charges - International Herald Tribune<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> Through a spokesman, Voiculescu declined to comment, on the grounds that in December 2004, at the time the contract was signed, he was just a shareholder, and not an administrator of Grivco.<ref name=sercan/>
In October 2009, following some articles in the press,<ref>[http://www.romanialibera.ro/a168442/politicieni-datori-milioane-de-euro-la-fisc.html]</ref> the Vice-President of the Romanian Senate, Dan Voiculescu, has undergone a vetting process carried out by the National Agency for Fiscal Administration (ANAF),<ref>[http://danvoiculescu.net/blog/wp-content/uploads/2009/10/comunicat-de-presa-anaf.pdf]</ref> verification based on which ANAF has established <ref>[http://danvoiculescu.net/blog/wp-content/uploads/2009/10/hppscan28.pdf]</ref> that the allegations surrounding the Senator Dan Voiculescu have no real basis.
On September 26 2013 Dan Voiculescu was found guilty and sentenced to 5 years in prison. In the case of using his political connections to influence the sell of the Institute for Alimentary Research to Grivco a company that he had a stake in. The case was postponed several years because Dan Voiculescu resigned several times for the Romanian Parliament.
On August 08 2014 Dan Voiculescu was found guilty an sentenced to 10 years in prison for money laundering. Money, a plot of land and a house were also confiscated to cover the state's losses.<ref>http://business-review.eu/featured/romanian-media-mogul-dan-voiculescu-sentenced-to-ten-years-in-prison-68412</ref>
On July 10 2017 he was released from prison.
== Criticism ==
President Băsescu has accused Voiculescu of being a "media mogul" who uses his media group to fight political battles. He further accused Voiculescu of trying to control, through the media, the politics of the country.<ref>[http://stiri.rol.ro/content/view/34889/2/ Stiri ROL.ro - Basescu: Voiculescu, Vintu si Patriciu utilizeaza trusturile media in batalia politica<!-- Bot generated title -->] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090327192258/http://stiri.rol.ro/content/view/34889/2/ |date=2009-03-27 }}</ref> In May 2007, Băsescu said "Oligarchs should not be confused with the business community. They are the few who have made fortunes thanks to facilities from government, people who have become very rich and now give orders to politicians, those who are supported financially by the oligarchs and who have turned into puppets of certain businessmen like Voiculescu, [Rompetrol owner Dinu] [[Dinu Patriciu|Patriciu]], and many others."<ref>{{cite web |url=http://english.hotnews.ro/Romanians-are-the-ones-to-decide-what-sort-of-state-Romania-should-be-articol_44960.htm |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2007-05-15 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070516064617/http://english.hotnews.ro/Romanians-are-the-ones-to-decide-what-sort-of-state-Romania-should-be-articol_44960.htm |archivedate=2007-05-16 |df= }}</ref> An [[Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe]] report on the [[Romanian presidential election, 2009|2009 presidential election]] found that the newspaper [[Jurnalul Naţional]] and television station [[Antena 1 (Romania)|Antena 1]], both owned by Voiculescu's family, were biased against the incumbent Băsescu.<ref>[http://www.osce.org/documents/odihr/2009/12/41929_en.pdf OSCE second round preliminary report]</ref> In the last years, Voiculescu tried to reinvent his public image through the Internet. He started a personal blog, showing a much lighter side of his personality,<ref>[http://danvoiculescu.net/blog/ Întâlnire cu Dan Voiculescu]</ref> and even began writing satirical guest posts for online journals non-related to his media empire.<ref>[http://www.dailycotcodac.ro/author/dan-voiculescu/ Daily Cotcodac] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110208140517/http://www.dailycotcodac.ro/author/dan-voiculescu/ |date=2011-02-08 }}</ref>
== See also == * [[List of corruption scandals in Romania]]
==References== {{reflist|2}}
==External links== * {{ro icon}} [http://www.cdep.ro/pls/parlam/structura.mp?idm=135&leg=2004&cam=1 Profile at the Romanian Chamber of Deputies site]
{{Authority control}}

{{EngvarB|date=January 2018}} {{Use dmy dates|date=January 2018}} {{Multiple issues| {{external links|date=September 2016}} {{Orphan|date=September 2016}} }}
'''David George Freeman''' (born 18 June 1984) is an Australian business owner, entrepreneur, skydiver and coconut specialist. His most well-known venture has been the creation of the FMCG brand [[H2Coco]], known for its three product lines; H2Coco Coconut Water, H2Coconut Oil and Cocoespresso.
Freeman illustrated his passion to become an entrepreneur at an early stage, his first business venture was a small marketing & events company<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.smh.com.au/business/meet-the-boss--20150803-giqrwe.html|title=Meet the boss|website=The Sydney Morning Herald}}</ref> which led him to develop an interest in the Sydney hospitality industry where he was offered the opportunity to invest into several bars and restaurants. He also started to develop an interest in construction through working with a project manager learning that management; development & leadership became his key strengths.
Freeman started to research the development of H2Coco in 2009 and launched the brand in 2010,<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.theshout.com.au/2015/04/12/article/Australian-venues-experience-a-health-kick/DIZUOXXSGR.html|title=Australian venues experience a health kick|website=The Shout}}</ref> having won various awards for its innovative approach to FMCG.
== Early life == Freeman was born in Sydney, Australia, the middle child of three children of Georgina McLoughlin (Born 4 April 1957), a former [[orthoptist]] and small business owner, and [[George Freeman (bookmaker)|George Freeman]] (22 January 1935 – 20 March 1990), a race-horse bookmarker, whose father was a doctor in Sydney.
Freeman was educated at [[Scots College (Sydney)|Scots College]], an elite prep school in [[Rose Bay, New South Wales|Rose Bay]], Sydney. He then continued to study Architecture at St George College.
== Career ==
=== Hospitality businesses === <u>The Backroom Sydney</u>
In April 2011, Freeman entered a joint venture with friend Raul Gonzales to open a 1950s-style basement bar, loosely modelled on chic New York City hotspots<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.dailytelegraph.com.au/entertainment/sydney-confidential/freeman-opens-speakeasy/story-e6frewz0-1226036882596|title=How David Freeman will change Kings Cross with new bar modelled on New York City hotspots|website=The Daily Telegraph}}</ref> with hopes to change the face of the Kings Cross – and greater Sydney – through his venture.
Sealed behind a mysterious Acme Bookstore façade on the Kings Cross strip The Backroom was a unique venue designed for a distinct clientele – only those who are aware of its existence. 1950s film noir influences the interior aesthetic with the brooding detective and the femme fatale noteworthy characters within the designed space. According to interior designer Kristie Paul of inochi design studio, David had a long list of quirky ideas.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.totalvenue.com.au/venue/the-backroom/|title=The Backroom|website=Total Venue}}</ref>
The Backroom was host to a series of international superstars, with names as big as Calvin Harris, Snoop Dogg and Justin Bieber<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.smh.com.au/entertainment/music/justin-bieber-gets-cozy-in-sydney-nightclubs-even-if-queensland-hotels-arent-to-his-taste-20131129-2yg3e.html|title=Justin Bieber gets cozy in Sydney nightclubs even if Queensland hotels aren't to his taste|website=The Sydney Morning Herald}}</ref> partying there and the likes of Brodinski and Rudimental stopping by for impromptu late night sets.
In September 2014, seven months after the NSW Government implemented their controversial lockout legislation, The Backroom Sydney, were forced to close its doors.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://inthemix.junkee.com/lockouts-force-kings-cross-club-the-backroom-to-close/25736|title=Lockouts force Kings Cross club The Backroom to close|website=In The Mix}}</ref>
<u>The Brooklyn Social</u>
=== Coconut ventures === [[Lara Bingle]] was brand ambassador in 2012 and 2013.
[[Kyle Sandilands]] is a key investor in H2Coco Pty Ltd.
== Awards == * David Freeman was named Young Entrepreneur of the Year at the 2014 Australian Small Business Champion Awards, having gained national ranging in key pharmacy franchise<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.foodanddrinkbusiness.com.au/news/coconut-cracks-the-beverage-market#lPL4pQJLq7eg5zpD.99|title=|website=}}</ref> * Finalist for – Employer of the year by Food Magazine Awards in July 2015, also Finalist for 3 awards * Specialised Small Business by Australian Small Business Awards in April 2016 by the Australian Small Business Champion Awards * Exporter of the Year by Optus MyBusiness Awards in August 2015 – Exporter of the years at the Optus My Business awards * Finalist for – the Best Local Venue by City Of Sydney Small Business Awards in June 2012 * Best Growth Strategy by My Business Magazine in September 2013 * H2Coco has established itself as an industry leader with its premium coconut-based products, the trending non-alcoholic beverage choice for 2015. * H2Coco was named the Best New Product of 2012 in the AdNews 2013 Annual Edition<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.adnews.com.au/adnews/best-new-products-of-2012|title=|website=}}</ref> * Finalist for – Best NSW Small Business Award by Telstra Business Awards in July 2015 were Finalist in the 2015 Telstra Business Awards
==References== {{Reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Freeman, David}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Australian businesspeople]] [[Category:1984 births]]

{{Use mdy dates|date=August 2014}} '''Donna Auguste''' (born 1958) is an African-American businesswoman, entrepreneur, and philanthropist. She was the founder and chief executive officer (CEO) of Freshwater Software from 1996 to 2001. Prior to Freshwater Software, she was a senior engineering manager at [[Apple Computer]] who helped to coordinate the development of the [[Newton PDA|Newton personal digital assistant]] (PDA).<ref name="first">Brown, Carolyn. [http://www.blackenterprise.com/magazine/2000/11/01/shes-fresh She's Fresh]. Black Enterprise Magazine. (November 1, 2000).</ref><ref name="second">[https://www.pbs.org/breakthrough/resource/augustebio.htm Breakthrough: Donna Auguste] PBS.</ref>
In 2001, she sold Freshwater Software to [[Mercury Interactive]] Corp. for $147 million. In the same year, she was recognized as one of the "25 Women Who Are Making It Big in Small Business" by [[Fortune (magazine)|Fortune Magazine]].<ref>[http://money.cnn.com/magazines/fsb/fsb_archive/2001/03/01/298108/index.htm 25 Women]. Fortune Magazine. (March 1, 2001).</ref> She also won the 2001 [[Golden Torch]] Award for Outstanding Woman in Technology.<ref name="third">[http://www.answers.com/topic/donna-m-auguste Golden Torch Award]</ref>
==Early life and education== Donna Auguste was born in [[Texas]] but relocated to [[Louisiana]] and then to [[Berkeley, California]]. She and her four sisters were raised by their mother. Since an early age, Auguste loved to tinker with things: from taking apart [[doorbell]]s to disassembling toasters and other electrical appliances. After graduating from high school, she enrolled in the [[electrical engineering]] and [[computer science]] (EECS) program at the [[University of California, Berkeley]] where she overcame many obstacles to earn her undergraduate Bachelor of Science degree in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science. She did graduate study in computer science at [[Carnegie-Mellon University]], where she earned her MS degree in 1983.<ref name="first"/><ref name="second"/>
==Career== While conducting research in [[applied science]] and [[artificial intelligence]] at Carnegie-Mellon University, Auguste interned at [[Xerox Corporation]]'s [[Palo Alto Research Center]] and met the future founders of [[IntelliCorp (software)|IntelliCorp]]. Auguste was hired by IntelliCorp as a software engineer in 1986 to work on technology products that incorporated artificial intelligence. After spending four years at IntelliCorp, Auguste took a break from work for two months to bike through Japan's countryside. Upon her return, Auguste was hired by Apple Computer in 1990 to serve as lead software engineering manager for the Newton PDA development project. While at Apple Computer, Auguste was well-liked and won praises for her managerial skills as well as technical contributions (she held various patents for her work on the Newton PDA).<ref name="first"/><ref name="second"/>
In 1996, Auguste relocated to [[Boulder, Colorado]] and joined U.S. West Advanced Technologies as senior director of [[multimedia]] [[systems engineering]] and [[Systems development|development]]. While working on [[interactive television]] applications for the company's [[Fiber-optic communication|fiber-optic]] broadband network, Auguste foresaw the potential of the internet and later launched her own company: Freshwater Software Inc., a provider of software solutions for maintaining and monitoring business-critical [[web application]]s. Freshwater Software grew rapidly from a tiny [[Startup company|start-up]] into a nationally recognized multimillion-dollar software provider which boasted [[Fortune 500]] clients such as [[Alta Vista]], [[IBM]], [[Microsoft]], [[Go.com]], and [[Merrill Lynch]]. Freshwater Software was later purchased by Mercury Interactive Corp. of California for $147 million in 2001.<ref>[http://denver.bizjournals.com/denver/stories/2001/05/21/daily9.html Freshwater Software Sold]. Denver Business Journal. (May 21, 2001).</ref><ref name="fourth">[http://www.informit.com/authors/bio.aspx?a=92bc70aa-1aec-43aa-8d9a-4f20fe7675d7 Donna Auguste]</ref>
==Personal life== Upon retiring after the sale of Freshwater Software, Auguste founded the Leave a Little Room Foundation, LLC, a philanthropic organization that helps provide housing, electricity, and vaccinations to poor and underprivileged communities around the world.<ref name="fourth"/>
In 2009, Auguste was awarded $750,000 from [[Santa Clara County, California|Santa Clara County]] as a settlement for winning a high-profile [[lawsuit]] stemming from questionable tactics used by the prosecutor from the [[district attorney]]'s office in a criminal case where Auguste's Colorado home was searched in connection with her nephew Damon Auguste's rape conviction which was later overturned.<ref>[http://www.mercurynews.com/search/ci_13527582?IADID High-tech entrepreneur to get ,50,000 from Santa Clara County in settlement over questionable house search]. San Jose Mercury News. (October 9, 2009).</ref> She is a Catholic and a member of Cure d'Ars Parish in [[Denver]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Illinois, Colorado Catholics offer helping hand to Mississippi parish|url=http://www.americancatholic.org/News/katrina/KatrinaPas.asp|work=americancatholic.org|agency=CNS|date=September 16, 2005}}</ref>
==Further reading== *{{cite book|url=http://www.worldcat.org/title/more-rags-to-riches-all-new-stories-of-how-ordinary-people-achieved-extraordinary-wealth/oclc/747403020|title=More rags to riches : all new stories of how ordinary people achieved extraordinary wealth|last1=Liberman|first1=Gail|last2=Lavine|first2=Alan|date=2002|publisher=Dearborn Trade Pub.|isbn=9780793145546|location=Chicago, Ill.|pages=}} *{{cite book|last1=Henderson|first1=Ashyia N|title=Contemporary Black biography. profiles from the international Black community Volume 29 Volume 29|date=2002|publisher=Gale Research Inc.|isbn=9781414435572|url=http://www.worldcat.org/oclc/527366305|language=English}} *{{cite web|title=Donna Auguste|url=https://www.ncwit.org/profile/donna-auguste|website=National Center for Women & Information Technology|language=en}}
==References== <references/>
==External links== *[http://www.girlgeeks.org/innergeek/inspiringwomen/auguste.shtml Women Who Inspire Us] *[http://www.moleskinerie.com/2007/06/donna_auguste_u.html Donna Auguste Uses a Moleskine]
{{authority control}}
